message_1: What is the chemical equation for the decomposition of silver nitrate (AgNO3) and the resulting products?
message_2:
The decomposition of silver nitrate (AgNO3) occurs when it is heated. The chemical equation for this decomposition is:

2 AgNO3 (s) â†’ 2 Ag (s) + O2 (g) + 2 NO2 (g)

Upon heating, silver nitrate decomposes into silver (Ag), oxygen gas (O2), and nitrogen dioxide gas (NO2).
